task.title: Create a Global Mbox
task.shortdesc: You can use a global mbox on every page where you want to optimize your content.

context.p: A global mbox is a term used in Adobe Target to describe an mbox that is coded at the top of the page and used to pull in offer code from Adobe Target to change content elsewhere on the page. It is not a "special" mbox in that there are no naming requirements or other rules, and it can be used for all kinds of content. The offers delivered in global mboxes typically use JQuery or other JavaScript to manipulate elements of the DOM outside of the global mbox. This means that content can be modified on the page even if it is not wrapped by its own mbox.
